title: Blended Instructional Motivation Design-Based Program for Enhancing Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Short-term intensive course emphasizing blended lesson design applying ARCS (Attention, Relevance, Confidence, Satisfaction) motivation theory. Inducing intrinsic motivation and sustained engagement through real-life math problem-solving

learning_goals: Learners can solve five or more math problems incorporating ARCS motivational strategies (Attention, Relevance, Confidence, Satisfaction) with 80% or higher accuracy
Learners can share problem-solving strategies three or more times and provide feedback through peer interactions on online discussion boards
Learners rate their motivation level and learning satisfaction at 4 points or higher (on a 5-point scale) in post-course surveys
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
